Class ServerHighscore

java.lang.Object
  HighscoreManager
      ServerHighscore

public class ServerHighscore
extends HighscoreManager

Saves the highscores to the Greenfoot server using UserInfo. This can be used if published to the Greenfoot Gallery.

UserInfo is originally designed to have only ONE highscore but we need one highscore for every level. To work around this limitation, we use the available integers and Strings to store a users moves for each level. The score is simply incremented whenever someone adds a new highscore entry. Then we can use the score to get the most recently added players.

We can save move information for a maximum of 105 levels. For each level we store a maximum of 999 moves.
The UserInfo can store 10 integers and 5 Strings of 50 characters (at the moment). In an integer we can store 3 levels, in a String 15 levels. This makes the following calcualtion:
3 levels * 10 integers = 30
15 levels * 5 Strings = 75
Total levels: 105

Note: Every User will only be stored once for every level, e.g. it is not possible for one user to be on first and second place.

Version:
1.3 (2012-07-04)
Author:
Marco Jakob (majakob@gmx.ch)

getHighscoreForLevel

public Highscore getHighscoreForLevel(int levelNumber)
Returns the Highscore for the specified level. The returned Highscore is a clone. To store a change in the highscore, the method setHighscore(...) must be called.
